history.content:
I found CS61C much more worthwhile than 170 both in terms of content and internship relevance. CS61C does more than introduce you to a variety of subfields, it also gives you an appreciation for how computer systems (from your laptop to warehouse-scale computing centres) work. Because as an intern you're likely to be shepparded into a company with an existing computing system (and you'll have to learn how to interact with it!) CS61C may be more relevant than you think. Also, if you don't have a set subfield in mind (think: what part of CS are you interested in doing an i ternship in?), CS61C introduces you to a lot of new industry areas too.Regarding 170, I found that it introduced me to a more algorithmic line of thinking, but the content itself wasn't "internship prep" material.

(It's worth noting, I'm a TA for 61C, so my bias is probably pretty strong.)

Next fall I will be a Sophomore (in EECS), and have so far completed CS61AB, CS70, EE16AB, and math 53. For my phase 1, I was originally going to sign up for CS61C and CS170 in addition to Physics 7B, but at the last minute I decided not to enroll in 61C, and instead picked up Astro 7A (to fulfill the last part of the natural science requirement). My reasoning was that I have heard many things about the heavy workload and difficulty of 61C and I have also heard that the knowledge gained in 170 is very important for job and internship interviews (whereas 61C is not so much except a few more specific subfields), and seeing as I would like to start looking for internships next semester/year, I thought it would be better to focus on 170 and push CS61C until after I have finished 170 and started looking for internships. However, as I have not taken either course, I am not completely sure of my decision. Could any students who have already taken these courses give me some insight or advice into whether or not I should delay 61C? Thanks.
history.subject: Should I put off 61C for a semester?
